message.content:
cs.CV, cs.LG, cs.IR, cs.CL, cs.MM 

The paper discusses a computer vision classification framework (NBNN) and proposes a method to extend its applicability outside of image-based domains by learning a metric that captures perceptual similarity. This suggests that the paper is likely to belong to the Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition (cs.CV) sub-category. Additionally, the proposed method involves optimizing a soft form of the NBNN selection rule, which suggests that the paper may also belong to the Machine Learning (cs.LG) sub-category. The paper also discusses retrieval tasks and the use of engineered descriptors (e.g. SIFT), which suggests that it may belong to the Information Retrieval (cs.IR) and Computation and Language (cs.CL) sub-categories. Finally, the empirical evaluation involves image and non-image datasets, which suggests that the paper may also belong to the Multimedia (cs.MM) sub-category.
